meanings.definition: A type of verse consisting of a single metrical foot.
meanings.sent1: In the monopody, each line only has one metrical foot.
meanings.sent2: Poets sometimes use monopody to create a specific rhythmic effect.
meanings.sent3: The monopody poem hopped along with its single foot rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her monopody of words danced lightly across the page.
meanings.sent5: The monopody verse echoed with the sound of a lone footstep.

meanings.definition: A sculpture or statue depicting a single foot.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a unique monopody of a foot sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The monopody in the park was a popular spot for photos.
meanings.sent3: The monopody statue of a foot stood out among the other artworks.
meanings.sent4: She admired the intricate details of the monopody carving.
meanings.sent5: The monopody of the foot seemed to be frozen in mid-step.

meanings.definition: A style of dance performed by a single dancer.
meanings.sent1: The monopody showcased the dancer's solo performance.
meanings.sent2: Audiences were captivated by the elegance of the monopody.
meanings.sent3: The monopody dance told a story of solitude and grace.
meanings.sent4: She practiced the monopody routine until every step was perfect.
meanings.sent5: The monopody performance left a lasting impression on the crowd.
